chart_metadata.name: zap2xml
chart_metadata.description: zap2xml fetches TV guide data from Zap2it and outputs XMLTV files for use with DVR software like Jellyfin, Plex, or Channels.

runAsContext.description: zap2xml runs as any non-root user.

groups.name: User and Group Configuration
groups.description: Configure User and Group for zap2xml

enum.description: 'Asia/Damascus' timezone
'Asia/Saigon' timezone

attrs.label: Output File Path
attrs.description: Path where the XMLTV file will be written inside the container.

attrs.label: Lineup ID
attrs.description: The Zap2it lineup ID for your TV provider (e.g., USA-OTA78735).

attrs.label: Timespan (hours)
attrs.description: Number of hours of guide data to fetch.

attrs.label: Postal Code
attrs.description: Your postal/ZIP code for location-based listings.

attrs.label: Cron Schedule
attrs.description:
Cron expression for when to fetch guide data.
Examples: "0 22 * * *" (10pm daily), "0 22 * * 2" (10pm every Tuesday),
"0 */6 * * *" (every 6 hours).

attrs.label: Additional Environment Variables
attrs.description: Additional environment variables to pass to the container.

attrs.label: User ID
attrs.description: The user ID that zap2xml will run as.

attrs.label: Group ID
attrs.description: The group ID that zap2xml will run as.

attrs.label: XMLTV Output Storage
attrs.description: Storage location for the XMLTV output file.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)

attrs.label: Enable ACL
attrs.description: Enable ACL for the storage.

attrs.label: Enable ACL
attrs.description: Enable ACL for the storage.

attrs.label: Host Path
attrs.description: The host path to use for storage.

attrs.label: Additional Storage
attrs.description: Additional storage locations.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)

attrs.label: Mount Path
attrs.description: The path inside the container to mount the storage.

attrs.label: Enable ACL
attrs.description: Enable ACL for the storage.

attrs.label: Host Path
attrs.description: The host path to use for storage.

attrs.label: CPU
attrs.description: CPU limit for the container.

schema.valid_chars_error:
Valid CPU limit formats are:
- Plain integer (e.g., 1)
- Float (e.g., 0.5)
- Millicpu (e.g., 500m)

attrs.label: Memory
attrs.description: Memory limit for the container.

schema.valid_chars_error:
Valid memory limit formats are:
- Suffixed with E/P/T/G/M/K (e.g., 1G)
- Suffixed with Ei/Pi/Ti/Gi/Mi/Ki (e.g., 1Gi)
- Plain integer in bytes (e.g., 1073741824)
- Exponential (e.g., 134e6)

1.0.4.app_readme:
zap2xml

zap2xml fetches TV guide data from Zap2it and outputs XMLTV files for use with DVR software.

Features

  • Automatically fetches TV guide data on a configurable schedule
  • Outputs standard XMLTV format compatible with most DVR software
  • Supports US OTA and cable lineups via Zap2it

Getting Started

  1. Configure your Lineup ID and Postal Code
  2. Set the output file path and update interval
  3. Point your DVR software to the XMLTV file location

Finding Your Lineup ID

Visit Zap2it and search for your location to find your lineup ID.
1.0.4.detailed_readme:
zap2xml

zap2xml fetches TV guide data from Zap2it and outputs XMLTV files for use with DVR software like Jellyfin, Plex, or Channels.

Configuration

| Parameter | Description | Default | |-----------|-------------|---------| | zap2xmlConfig.outputFile | Path to output XMLTV file | /xmltv/xmltv.xml | | zap2xmlConfig.lineupId | Zap2it lineup ID | USA-OTA78735 | | zap2xmlConfig.timespan | Hours of guide data to fetch | 168 | | zap2xmlConfig.postalCode | Postal/ZIP code | 78735 | | zap2xmlConfig.sleepTime | Seconds between updates | 21600 |

Storage

The chart creates an ixVolume for the XMLTV output by default. You can configure additional storage mounts as needed.

Usage

Point your DVR software (Jellyfin, Plex, Channels, etc.) to the XMLTV file location to import guide data.
